context: The Finnish verb 'puhua' means 'to speak' or 'to talk'. It's an -verb, which is the basic form of the verb. In different contexts and conjugations, it can be used to describe speaking any language or engaging in conversation. The word changes form depending on the subject: 'minä puhun' (I speak), 'sinä puhut' (you speak), 'hän puhuu' (he/she speaks), etc.
